greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A run of 2^n 1's followed by a run of 2^n 2's, for n=0, 1, 2, ...
comment: In the sequence of nonnegative integers (cf. A001477) substitute all n by 2^floor(n/2) occurrences of (1 + n mod 2); a(n)=A173920(n+2,3) for n>0. [From _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 04 2010]
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = floor(log[2](8*(n+2)/3)) - floor(log[2](n+2)). - Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)hotmail.com), Feb 22 2003
xref: Partial sums give A079945. Equals 1 + A079944. Cf. A080584.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 21 2003
